wikipedia_page.main: Lt Col Sir William James Allen KBE DSO (15 October 1866 – 20 December 1947) was a Northern Irish unionist politician, soldier and businessman.

:At the 1922 and 1923 general elections, William Allen was elected unopposed.
:At the 1931 general election, William Allen was elected unopposed.

response: The North Armagh by-election of 1917 was held on 22 November 1917.  The by-election was held due to the incumbent Conservative MP, Sir William Moore, becoming a Judge of the High Court of Justice in Ireland. It was won by the Conservative candidate William Allen, who was unopposed.
